w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic toy concepts by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
video games, action figures, skateboard, bike.
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for toys
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: play, video games, television, computer, watch, action figures, dolls, ride, skateboard, bike
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about toys!”
Say phrase and have student repeat.
Say target words one at a time. Have student circle and spell them.
. Say the words, one at a time.
Circle the toys to play with:
video games, bike, action figures, skateboard
Read the question “What toys will I play with?” Emphasize the target words. Physicalize the word,
, by pretending to press buttons on a controller.bn Visual cue: Use a real controller or, al
ternatively, use a small toy as a prop.
Circle each picture one at a time. Act out each picture (video games, bike, action figures, skateboard). Have the student repeat.
Visual cue: Show pictures of video games.
Use TPR: Act out struggling and winning a difficult Boss Battle
, and spell it. Have the student repeat.
I play video games on my _____
, and draw a line to the consoles one at a time. Have the student repeat, finishing the sentence,
I play video games on my _____.
, one at a time. Have student repeat.
, one at a time. Have student read. Switch roles.
, say phrase. Encourage student to repeat with action.
Say and act out the phrase,
I will play with my action figures
. Have student read the word. Switch roles.
Visual cues: Teacher can show different types of action figures. Student can repeat.
, and act it out using an action figure.
and spell it. Have the student repeat.
Repeat the phrase with an action. Encourage the student to repeat with the same action.
Visual aid: Show a picture of sharing.
, and say it. Have student repeat.
Have student say phrase once with each target word.
Visual cue: Show pictures of board games
If you have a real board game, use a game piece and move it around one square as you spell,
. Alternatively, clap. Encourage student to repeat.
Say phrase. Put have over ear to indicate the student to repeat.
Draw a line to indoor and outdoor toys
Write target words and have student read them. Switch roles.
Draw a line to each outdoor toy item. Have the student repeat it.
. Have student repeat with the same action.
, and say the word. Have student repeat.
TPR: To act out riding a bike. Example: Reach out your arms as if you are holding handlebars.
Have students circle the target words, one at a time, and spell.
Visual cues: More pictures of people riding skateboards.
TPR: Stand and act out riding a skateboard. Alternatively use or fingers or an action figure.
. Say/spell the word. Have student repeat.
Say, “I pedal my bike.” Act out
. Have child repeat with same action. Do the same for the phrase, “I push my skateboard.” Act out
Push with the phrase, “I pedal my bike.” Have the student correct you.
Say, “My computer can play video games.”
, and have student circle the target word and spell it.
Circle the toys you play with indoors
Write the target words and have student read them. Switch roles.
Say phrase and have student circle each indoor toy and say them one at a time.
Circle outdoor toys and have student correct you.
Say phrase and have student repeat.
Say phrase and circle toys that require helmets;
Have student fill in the blank.
Have student draw a line from toy into toy box. Say the associated word,
action figures, video games, board games.
Say a target word. Encourage student to respond by circling the correct image and spelling the target word.
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Students should have a blank slide to draw a picture of
video games, action figures, bike, skateboard
Read words from the lesson (video games, action figures, bike, skateboard, etc.)
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
video games, action figures, bike, skateboard
through pictures. One prompt at a time.
Teacher will write words from the lesson (
video games, action figures, bike, skateboard,
etc.) and student will read them.
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
video games, action figures, bike, skateboard
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
